intro: Ozothamnus purpurascens, commonly known as the pink chamaedorea, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows as a low, spreading shrub with grey-green foliage and produces showy pink to purple flowers. It is well adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, making it a resilient choice for drought-tolerant gardens. Ozothamnus purpurascens is often used in landscaping for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in poor soil conditions.
